attributes.action: Reverse orders for GPs to do fewer checks & monitoring
attributes.additional_details: Throughout this pandemic those with existing health conditions or over 75s have slipped under the radar as the government solely focuses on Covid-19 patients. This recent decision will only lead to further deaths and illnesses. We cannot continue to prioritise Covid-19 whilst allowing the suffering of other patients. This decision needs to be reversed immediately by ministers.
attributes.background: It has been decided that doctors will spend less time monitoring people with conditions such as diabetes & heart problems, do fewer health checks on people over 75 & stop performing minor surgery until April in order to ‘urgently deliver booster jabs’. This decision urgently needs to be reversed.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Changes to NHS operations to increase capacity to deliver the Covid-19 booster programme are an operational matter for the NHS, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament.

You can read more about these changes here: https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/publication/jcvi-advice-in-response-to-the-emergence-of-the-b-1-1-529-omicron-variant-next-steps-for-deployment/
